'Alexander II of Russia' (, Aleksandr II Nikolaevich) ( in Moscow â in Saint
Petersburg) was the Emperor of Russia from 2 March 1855 until his assassination
in 1881. He was also the King of Poland and the Grand Prince of Finland. His
most important achievement was the emancipation of serfs in 1861, for which he
became known as 'Alexander the Liberator' (, Aleksandr Osvoboditel').
